com.google.wave.api
Class WaveService

java.lang.Object
  com.google.wave.api.WaveService

public class WaveService
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class for using OAuth to talk to Wave service.

Method Detail

setupOAuth

public void setupOAuth(java.lang.String consumerKey,
                       java.lang.String consumerSecret,
                       java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
Sets the OAuth related properties, including the consumer key and secret that are used to sign the outgoing operations.

This version of the method is for 2-legged OAuth, where the robot is not acting on behalf of a user.

Parameters:
consumerKey - the consumer key.
consumerSecret - the consumer secret.
rpcServerUrl - the URL of the server that serves the JSON-RPC request.
  • https://www-opensocial.googleusercontent.com/api/rpc - for wave preview.
  • https://www-opensocial-sandbox.googleusercontent.com/api/rpc - for wave sandbox.

setupOAuth

public void setupOAuth(OAuthAccessor accessor,
                       java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
Sets the OAuth related properties that are used to sign the outgoing operations for 3-legged OAuth.

Performing the OAuth dance is not part of this interface - once you've done the dance, pass the constructed accessor and rpc endpoint into this method.

Ensure that the endpoint URL you pass in matches exactly the URL used to request an access token (including https vs http).

Parameters:
accessor - the OAuthAccessor with access token and secret
rpcServerUrl - the endpoint URL of the server that serves the JSON-RPC request.
  • https://www-opensocial.googleusercontent.com/api/rpc - for wave preview.
  • https://www-opensocial-sandbox.googleusercontent.com/api/rpc - for wave sandbox.

validateOAuthRequest

public void validateOAuthRequest(java.lang.String requestUrl,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> requestParams,
                                 java.lang.String jsonBody,
                                 java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
                          throws OAuthException
Validates the incoming HTTP request.

Parameters:
requestUrl - the URL of the request.
jsonBody - the request body to be validated.
rpcServerUrl - the RPC server URL.
Throws:
OAuthException - if it can't validate the request.

submit

public java.util.List<JsonRpcResponse> submit(Wavelet wavelet,
                                              java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
Submits the pending operations associated with this Wavelet.

Parameters:
wavelet - the bundle that contains the operations to be submitted.
rpcServerUrl - the active gateway to send the operations to.
Returns:
a list of JsonRpcResponse that represents the responses from the server for all operations that were submitted.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called prior to setting the proper consumer key, secret, and handler URL.
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem submitting the operations.

blindWavelet

public Wavelet blindWavelet(WaveId waveId,
                            WaveletId waveletId)
Returns an empty/blind stub of a wavelet with the given wave id and wavelet id. Call this method if you would like to apply wavelet-only operations without fetching the wave first. The returned wavelet has its own OperationQueue. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure this wavelet gets submitted to the server, either by calling AbstractRobot.submit(Wavelet, String) or by calling Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet, to join its queue with another wavelet, for example, the event wavelet.

Parameters:
waveId - the id of the wave.
waveletId - the id of the wavelet.
Returns:
a stub of a wavelet.

blindWavelet

public Wavelet blindWavelet(WaveId waveId,
                            WaveletId waveletId,
                            java.lang.String proxyForId)
Parameters:
proxyForId - the proxying information that should be set on the operation queue. Please note that this parameter should be properly encoded to ensure that the resulting participant id is valid (see Util.checkIsValidProxyForId(String) for more details).
See Also:
blindWavelet(WaveId, WaveletId)

newWave

public Wavelet newWave(java.lang.String domain,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> participants)
Creates a new wave with a list of participants on it. The root wavelet of the new wave is returned with its own OperationQueue. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure this wavelet gets submitted to the server, either by calling AbstractRobot.submit(Wavelet, String) or by calling Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet.

Parameters:
domain - the domain to create the wavelet on. In general, this should correspond to the domain of the incoming event wavelet, except when the robot is calling this method outside of an event or when the server is handling multiple domains.
participants - the initial participants on the wave. The robot, as the creator of the wave, will be added by default. The order of the participants will be preserved.

newWave

public Wavelet newWave(java.lang.String domain,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> participants,
                       java.lang.String proxyForId)
Parameters:
proxyForId - the proxy id that should be used to create the new wave. If specified, the creator of the wave would be robotid+@appspot.com. Please note that this parameter should be properly encoded to ensure that the resulting participant id is valid (see Util.checkIsValidProxyForId(String) for more details).
See Also:
newWave(String, Set)

newWave

public Wavelet newWave(java.lang.String domain,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> participants,
                       java.lang.String msg,
                       java.lang.String proxyForId)
Parameters:
msg - the message that will be passed back to the robot when WAVELET_CREATED event is fired as a result of this operation.
See Also:
newWave(String, Set, String)

newWave

public Wavelet newWave(java.lang.String domain,
                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> participants,
                       java.lang.String msg,
                       java.lang.String proxyForId,
                       java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
                throws java.io.IOException
Parameters:
rpcServerUrl - if specified, this operation will be submitted immediately to this active gateway, that will return immediately the actual wave id, the id of the root wavelet, and id of the root blip.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem submitting the operation to the server, when submit is true.
See Also:
newWave(String, Set, String, String)

fetchWavelet

public Wavelet fetchWavelet(WaveId waveId,
                            WaveletId waveletId,
                            java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Fetches a wavelet using the active API. The returned wavelet contains a snapshot of the state of the wavelet at that point. It can be used to modify the wavelet, but the wavelet might change in between, so treat carefully. Also, the returned wavelet has its own OperationQueue. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure this wavelet gets submitted to the server, either by calling AbstractRobot.submit(Wavelet, String) or by calling Wavelet.submitWith(Wavelet) on the new wavelet.

Parameters:
waveId - the id of the wave to fetch.
waveletId - the id of the wavelet to fetch.
rpcServerUrl - the active gateway that is used to fetch the wavelet.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem fetching the wavelet.

fetchWavelet

public Wavelet fetchWavelet(WaveId waveId,
                            WaveletId waveletId,
                            java.lang.String proxyForId,
                            java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Parameters:
proxyForId - the proxy id that should be used to fetch this wavelet. Please note that this parameter should be properly encoded to ensure that the resulting participant id is valid (see Util.checkIsValidProxyForId(String) for more details).
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
fetchWavelet(WaveId, WaveletId, String)

hasConsumerData

protected boolean hasConsumerData(java.lang.String rpcServerUrl)
Returns:

createOAuthUrlString

public static java.lang.String createOAuthUrlString(java.lang.String jsonBody,
                                                    java.lang.String rpcServerUrl,
                                                    OAuthAccessor accessor)
                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                    java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                    OAuthException
Creates a URL that contains the necessary OAuth query parameters for the given JSON string.

Parameters:
jsonBody - the JSON string to construct the URL from.
rpcServerUrl - the URL of the handler that services the JSON-RPC request.
accessor - the OAuth accessor used to create the signed string.
Returns:
a URL for the given JSON string, and the required OAuth parameters:
  • oauth_body_hash
  • oauth_consumer_key
  • oauth_signature_method
  • oauth_timestamp
  • oauth_nonce
  • oauth_version
  • oauth_signature
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.net.URISyntaxException
OAuthException
